quote: “Happy labor day... Enjoy it.”
author: Tweeted by Lakers small forward Metta World Peace on Memorial Day, 2012.

quote: “People think we make $3 million and $4 million a year. They don’t realize that most of us only make $500,000.",
author: Pete Incaviglia, former Texas Rangers outfielder on why baseball players aren’t overpaid.

quote: “That’s part of the challenge of being a professional athlete.”
author: Former Houston Rockets backup center John Amaechi on not receiving a single minute of playing time during the season.

quote: “Hawaii doesn’t win many games in the United States.”
author: ESPN analyst Lee Corso on the University of Hawaii’s poor record against teams in mainland America.

quote: “Therapy can be a good thing; it can be therapeutic.",
author: Alex Rodriguez, New York Yankees third baseman.

quote: “The game was closer than the score indicated.”
author: MLB Hall of Fame pitcher Dizzy Dean after a 1-0 game.

quote: “Well, either side could win it, or it could be a draw.”
author: Ron Atkinson, former soccer player and television pundit.

quote: “I’m tellin’ ya man, to be able to stroke it like that must be some kind of feeling.”
author: Dick Vitale on J.J. Redick’s three-point shooting.

quote: Seattle Seahawks wide receiver Steve Largent explained which of his records he’ll cherish the most after retiring from football:
author: “Probably the Beatles’ White Album.”

quote: “I think that’s my biggest key in my workout... with swimming and weights... is like my weight room."
author: Ryan Lochte, Olympic swimmer and weight room appreciator.

quote: “Aw, how could he lose the ball in the sun? He’s from Mexico.”
author: Former Cubs announcer Harry Caray on Jorge Orta losing track of a fly ball.

quote: “It’s humbling being humble.”
author: Maurice Clarett, former Denver Broncos running back.

quote: “That’s all they said was wrong with me?”
author: Former heavyweight champ Mike Tyson responding to questions about him suffering from depression, low self-esteem and problems with anger management.

quote: “Saltwater taffy.”
author: Former NBA big man Caldwell Jones on his favorite seafood.

quote: “Why should we have to go to class if we came here to play FOOTBALL, we ain’t come to play SCHOOL, classes are POINTLESS.”
author: Tweet sent out by Ohio State backup quarterback Cardale Jones.

quote: “Chemistry is a class you take in high school or college, where you figure out two plus two is 10 or something.”
author: Dennis Rodman explaining team chemistry.

quote: “It ain’t the heat. It’s the humility.”
author: Yankee legend Yogi Berra

quote: “It’s permanent, for now.”
author: Former MLB outfielder Roberto Kelly on whether or not he would change his nickname “Bobby” in the future.

quote: “They throw [Dave] Winfield out at second—and he’s safe.”
author: San Diego Padres broadcaster Jerry Coleman

quote: “That picture was taken out of context.”
author: New York Mets pitcher Jeff Innis on a photo of him that he believed made him look goofy.

quote: “We’re leaving a big fat rail of coke and a shot of Jack for Santa this year... cookies and milk will just slow him down. #SimpleTruth”
author: Tweet by Patriots linebacker Brandon Spikes this past holiday season.

quote: “I guess that makes our biggest weakness lack of strength.”
author: Gene Stallings, Texas A&M football coach after hearing TCU head coach Abe Martin claim his team’s biggest strength is its lack of weakness.

quote: “I believe I am more intelligent than the average person. There are few people with such talent, so there are few able to judge what I am doing.”
author: Italian footballer Mario Balotelli on his past antics involving dart-throwing at youth league players and sneaking into a women’s prison.

quote: “You can sum up this sport in two words: You never know.”
author: Boxing trainer Lou Duva.

quote: After being asked what he had gotten out of his rookie season in the league, former MLB outfielder Hensley Meulens replied:
author: “Oh, $120,000.”

quote: “I just got caught up in the moment, and, oh well.”
author: U.S. snowboarder Lindsey Jacobellis to NBC’s Bob Costas. Jacobellis had just lost the 2006 gold medal for snowboardcross after botching a trick and falling down yards from the finish line.

quote: “I feel like I’m the best, but you’re not going to get me to say that.”
author: NFL legend Jerry Rice

quote: “Yo soy fiesta!”
author: Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski in response to an ESPN Deportes reporter’s questions about how he plans to celebrate a win over the Baltimore Ravens.

quote: “They always put the smart guys out in right field. That’s where I used to play.”
author: Former MLB slugger Jose Canseco

quote: “I feel very Dominican.”
author: Alex Rodriguez on which nation he would play for in the first World Baseball Classic.

quote: “When you’re rich you don’t write checks... straight cash, homey.”
author: Randy Moss when asked how he’ll pay an NFL fine for unsportsmanlike celebration.

quote: Former Seattle SuperSonics center Jerome James explained his personal views on coach Nate McMillan calling him selfish with this little ditty:
author: “I don’t have the first clue who he is talking about, because all I worry about is Jerome.”

quote: “Gaylord Perry and Willie McCovey should know each other like a book. They’ve been ex-teammates for years now.”
author: Jerry Coleman, San Diego Padres broadcaster

quote: “It was no Mozart.”
author: Bill Cowher after a tough victory on the gridiron.

quote: “It may not impress you, but Holtz means ‘hard wood.’”
author: Former college football coach and television analyst Lou Holtz.

quote: “We must have had 99 percent of the match. It was the other three percent that cost us.”
author: Dutch soccer manager Ruud Gullit

quote: “Sam is an idiot—I-D-O-U-T—idiot.”
author: Shaquille O’Neal on Chicago Tribune writer Sam Smith, who wrote an article suggesting the Miami Heat rid themselves of "The Big Aristotle.",

quote: “Don’t say I don’t get along with my teammates. I just don’t get along with some of the guys on my team.”
author: Former NFL wide receiver Terrell Owens

quote: “He’s the Man of the Hour, at this particular moment.”
author: Boxing promoter Don King

quote: Former San Francisco Giants coach Rocky Bridges was asked why he refused to eat snails, to which he responded:
author: “I prefer fast food.”

quote: “It’s going to be about me.”
author: Former NFL great Lawrence Taylor describing the autobiography he planned to write.

quote: “I’m not an athlete. I’m a professional baseball player.”
author: Former MLB first baseman and television analyst John Kruk

quote: “I’ve only scratched the iceberg.”
author: Tennis great Andre Agassi assessing his talent ceiling in 1990.

quote: After being asked about her love life during a promotional event for a line of undergarments she endorses, former tennis star Anna Kournikova had this to say:
author: “I’m not here to talk about my personal life. I’m here to talk about bras.”

quote: After hearing an unproductive member of the team had been traded away, Philadelphia Phillies outfielder Lenny Dykstra reacted with:
author: “Great trade! Who did we get?”

quote: “Raise the urinals.”
author: Former backup shortstop Darrel Chaney’s advice on how the front office can keep the Braves on their toes.

quote: “Michael Jordan is probably the greatest scorer to ever play in the game. But I may go so far to say LeBron James may be the greatest player to ever play the game.”
author: Scottie Pippen

quote: “Yankees pitchers have had great success against Cabrera when they get him out.”
author: Former MLB catcher and current sportscaster Tim McCarver

quote: “He might’ve won the war, but the battle’s not over.”
author: NFL running back Cadillac Williams on getting picked later in 2005 draft than his Auburn teammate Ronnie Brown.

quote: “The word genius isn’t applicable in football. A genius is a guy like Norman Einstein.”
author: Former Washington Redskins quarterback Joe Theisman

quote: “Ninety percent of this game is half mental.”
author: Yankess legend Yogi Berra

quote: “The only thing that keeps this organization from being recognized as one of the finest in baseball is wins and losses at the major league level.
author: Chuck Lamar, former Tampa Bay Devil Rays manager

quote: “What defines me? ...Ryan Lochte.”
author: Ryan Lochte, Olympic swimmer and horrendous interviewee

quote: “I’m traveling to all 51 states to see who can stop 85.”
author: Former NFL wide receiver Chad Johnson

quote: “My career was sputtering until I did a 360 and got headed in the right direction.”
author: Former Orlando Magic star Tracy McGrady

quote: “We’re going to turn this team around 360 degrees.”
author: New York Knicks guard Jason Kidd after being drafted by the Dallas Mavericks.

quote: “I’m rich. What am I supposed to do? Hide it?”
author: Former Detroit Tigers second baseman Lou Whitaker, after showing up to a players’ union meeting in a stretch limousine.

quote: “We’ll do all right if we can capitalize on our mistakes.”
author: Mickey Rivers, former MLB designated hitter

quote: “Sometimes they write what I say, not what I mean.”
author: Pedro Guerrero, former MLB baseball player

quote: “It’s war. They’re out there to kill you, so I’m out there to kill them. We don’t care about nobody but this U... I’m a soldier!”
author: University of Miami tight end Kellen Winslow after a loss to Tennessee in 2003

quote: “I ain’t gonna be no escape-goat!”
author: NBA Hall of Famer Karl Malone

quote: Sportscaster Tim McCarver on increased home run rates in the MLB:
author: “It has not been proven, but I think it will be proven that the air is thinner now, there have been climactic changes over the last 50 years in the world, and I think that’s one of the reasons balls are carrying much better now than I remember.”

quote: “It’s not going to be peaches and gravy all the time.”
author: Former Indiana Pacers center Brad Miller showcasing an interesting palate when he described the team’s struggles to reporters.

quote: “Son, looks to me like you’re spending too much time on one subject."
author: Former Texas A&M basketball coach Shelby Metcalf explaining what he told one of his players who received four F’s and one D on his report card.

quote: “Because there are no fours.”
author: Former NBA power forward Antoine Walker on why he shoots so many three-pointers.

quote: “I dunno. I never smoked any Astroturf."
author: Former Philly Tug McGraw on whether he preferred grass or Astroturf.

quote: “It’s almost like we have ESPN or something.”
author: Lakers great Magic Johnson on how he and teammate James Worthy always work so well together on the basketball court.

quote: “Rice defends against the free throw as well as anybody I’ve seen.”
author: Former Texas A&M basketball coach Shelby Metcalf

quote: “I’ve got my family to feed.”
author: Former NBA swingman Latrell Sprewell on why he wanted to sign a contract extension or be traded after making $14.6 million during the 2004-05 season.

quote: "Surprise me.”
author: Yankees legend Yogi Berra on where his wife should bury him.

quote: "I PRAISE YOU 24/7!!!!!! AND THIS HOW YOU DO ME!!!!! YOU EXPECT ME TO LEARN FROM THIS??? HOW???!!! ILL NEVER FORGET THIS!! EVER!!! THX THO..."
author: Buffalo Bills wide receiver Stevie Johnson tweeted this message, presumably to the creator of the universe, after dropping a game-winning catch in 2010.

quote: “I may be dumb, but I’m not stupid.”
author: Former NFL great and current NFL analyst Terry Bradshaw.

quote: “He treats us like men. He lets us wear earrings.”
author: Former University of Houston wide receiver Torrin Polk on former coach John Jenkins

quote: Former MLB outfielder and base-stealing extraordinaire Rickey Henderson on a writer’s claim that 50 percent of major league baseball players use steroids:
author: “Well, I’m not one of them. So that’s 49 percent right there.",

quote: “I’ve had to overcome a lot of diversity.”
author: Drew Gooden, Milwaukee Bucks forward-center

quote: “I’m very appreciative of being indicted.”
author: Former Florida State football coach Bill Peterson on being inducted into the Florida Hall of Fame.

quote: “I’m a four-wheel-drive pickup type of guy, and so is my wife.”
author: Former Red Sox outfielder Mike Greenwell

quote: When San Francisco Giants fans began chanting “Barry! Barry! Barry!” for Giants pitcher Barry Zito in Game 1 of the 2012 World series, broadcaster Joe Buck set up fellow sportscaster Tim McCarver for an easy home run:
author: “They used to say [Barry] for somebody else around here,” said Buck. “When Barry Manilow was playing in a concert,” replied McCarver. “Or Barry Bonds,” said Buck, incredulous.

quote: “Better make it six. I can’t eat eight.”
author: Former MLB pitcher Dan Osinski after a waitress asked him if he wanted his pizza cut into six slices or eight.

quote: “I’m just happy that Jesus Christ did not let me lose my teeth when I was 20-years-old.”
author: Lakers small forward Metta World Peace when asked how his teammates were reacting to his name change.

quote: “I want to rush for 1,000 or 1,500 yards—whichever comes first.”
author: South Carolina Heisman Trophy winner George Rogers

quote: “We didn’t underestimate them. They were a lot better than we thought.”
author: Former English football manager Bobby Robson, on narrowly surviving a game against Cameroon in the 1990 World Cup.

quote: “They shouldn’t throw at me. I’m the father of five or six kids.”
author: Former MLB player Tito Fuentes on getting hit by pitches.

quote: "There someone warming up in the bullpen, but he's obscured by his number."
author: Jerry Coleman, San Diego Padres broadcaster

quote: “He’s a guy who gets up at six o’clock in the morning regardless of what time it is.”
author: Lou Duva on the rigorous training regimen of heavyweight Andrew Golota.

quote: “I don’t think anyone on this team knows what ‘schism’ is, let alone could use it in a sentence. I thought it was an STD when I first heard it and was like ‘whoa, we preach abstinence in these parts.’"
author: Vikings defensive end Jared Allen said this about the possibility of a hostile “schism” growing in the locker room between teammates.

quote: “I owe a lot to my parents, especially my mother and father.”
author: Professional golfer Greg Norman

quote: “It isn’t like I came down from Mount Sinai with the tabloids.”
author: Former Indianapolis Colts head coach Ron Meyer, on whether or not he made the right decision by starting rookie quarterback Jeff George.

quote: “I can shoot with my left hand, I can shoot with my right hand. I’m amphibious.”
author: Charles Shackleford, former NBA forward

quote: Brother Ray Page, a teacher at St. Anthony High School in Jersey City, N.J., claims he once had to explain a geographical conundrum to his student, Bobby Hurley, who would go on to play for the Sacramento Kings:
author: “[Bobby Hurley] once asked me if Beirut was named after that famous baseball player who hit home runs.”

quote: “We do the same things here.”
author: Former Chicago Bulls star Dennis Rodman on North Korean dictator Kim Jung Un using prison camps to punish alleged criminals.

quote: “My sister’s expecting a baby, and I don’t know if I’m going to be an aunt or an uncle.”
author: NC State basketball player Chuck Nevitt explaining to his coach why he appeared nervous during practice.

quote: “Anyone with knowledge of the slave trade and the NFL could say that these two parallel each other.”
author: Pittsburgh Steelers running back Rashard Mendenhall tweeted this nugget of historical wisdom in 2011.

quote: “I want all the kids to copulate me."
author: Chicago Cubs Hall of Famer Andre Dawson on being a role model for children.

quote: “Fade into Bolivian, I guess.”
author: Former heavyweight champ Mike Tyson on what he would do after retiring from boxing.

quote: “We’re not attempting to circumcise the rules.”
author: Former Steelers head coach Bill Cowher

quote: Never one to hold back on the crazy, Jose Canseco unleashed these dinosaur/physics related tweets on his followers earlier this month:
author: “Ancient gravity was much weaker..."“Gravity had to be weaker to make dinosaurs nimble.”

quote: “The Bible never says anything about dinosaurs. You can't say there were dinosaurs when you never saw them. Someone actually saw Adam and Eve. No one ever saw a Tyrannosaurus Rex."
author: Former MLB outfielder Carl Everett

quote: “The sun has been there for 500, 600 years.”
author: Former MLB outfielder Mike Cameron

quote: “I can’t really remember the names of the clubs that we went to.”
author: Shaquille O’Neal’s response to whether or not he had stopped at the Parthenon while in Greece.
